destination.name: Sajek Valley
destination.overview: Sajek Valley, known as the 'Queen of Hills', is one of the most breathtaking destinations in Bangladesh. Located in the Rangamati district, it’s a serene escape surrounded by rolling green hills, tribal villages, and sea of clouds. The valley offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, cultural experience, and adventure.

itinerary.title: Arrival and Local Exploration
itinerary.description: The adventure begins as you leave Dhaka overnight, arriving in Khagrachari early in the morning. The scenic drive to Sajek through Dighinala offers breathtaking hill views. After checking into your resort, you’ll explore Konglak Para, a remote tribal village, and enjoy a sunset from the helipad viewpoint.
activities: Jeep ride to Sajek Valley via Dighinala
Check-in at resort and freshen up
Dinner with tribal BBQ at night

itinerary.title: Exploring the Beauty of Sajek
itinerary.description: Spend your second day exploring tribal culture, hidden viewpoints, and natural serenity. Wake up to a breathtaking sunrise, visit the Ruilui Para tribal village, and enjoy a peaceful afternoon in nature. In the evening, take part in a cultural night under the stars.
activities: Early morning sunrise view from Helipad
Visit Ruilui Para & Sajek Army Camp Viewpoint
Evening cultural show at local community hall

itinerary.title: Return Journey
itinerary.description: On your last day, capture the final sunrise over the valley before returning to Dhaka. Visit the Hajachora Waterfall on the way down and explore Khagrachari town before heading home.
activities: Visit Hajachora Waterfall on way down

meals.dinner: On the way or at bus stop

weather.forecast: Mild and cool with light fog in the morning

notes: Always carry your NID or Passport. Drone flying requires permission from the local army camp. Respect tribal culture and avoid littering.

destination.name: Bandarban
destination.overview: Bandarban is a dramatic hill district in southeastern Bangladesh, where emerald valleys, cloud-kissed peaks, and indigenous cultures combine to create one of the country's most evocative landscapes. Often called the 'Darjeeling of Bangladesh' in parts, Bandarban offers towering viewpoints such as Nilgiri and Thanchi routes, hidden waterfalls, and close encounters with the Mro, Marma and Bawm communities. This 3-day adventure is built for travelers who crave sunrise-from-the-summit experiences, jeep-track journeys through winding ridge roads, and gentle treks to isolated tribal villages and waterfalls. Expect chilly dawns, breathtaking panoramas over layered hills, and local hospitality that introduces you to traditional crafts, music and cuisine.

details.segment: Local jeep rides (Chander Gari) for hill sightseeing

itinerary.title: Arrival & Nilgiri Sunset
itinerary.description: Leave Dhaka/Chittagong overnight or early morning and arrive in Bandarban. After a short rest, take a jeep to Nilgiri viewpoint. Explore local tribal markets and watch a dramatic sunset from the hilltop.
activities: Jeep ride to Nilgiri tourist point
Short trek to viewpoint and sunrise/sunset photography

itinerary.title: Tribal Villages & Waterfalls
itinerary.description: Set out for a fuller exploration of Bandarban's tribal villages, rolling hills, and waterfalls. Visit a remote Mro village, hike to a waterfall, and spend the evening sampling tribal dishes and cultural stories.
activities: Visit Boga Lake (or local waterfall depending on road access)

itinerary.title: Short Trek & Return
itinerary.description: Final short trek to a nearby viewpoint for sunrise, then a relaxed descent back to Bandarban town for last-minute shopping before heading to Chittagong/Dhaka.
activities: Visit Shoilo Propat or other accessible waterfall

weather.forecast: Cool mornings with possible mist; afternoons mild

notes: Roads are hilly and sometimes rough; jeep rides (Chander Gari) are part of the experience. Respect local customs at tribal villages and ask before photographing individuals.

destination.name: Cox's Bazar
destination.overview: Cox's Bazar is famed for having one of the world's longest natural unbroken sea beaches, where golden sands meet the Bay of Bengal across a sweeping coastline. This 4-day itinerary mixes relaxing beach time, coastal exploration along the scenic Marine Drive, visits to Himchari and Inani Beach, and optional island or fishing-village excursions. Expect long walks at sunrise, fresh seafood feasts, and relaxing evenings by bonfires (seasonal). The Marine Drive offers a spectacular hill-and-sea panorama and is perfect for sunset drives and photography.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Beach Walk
itinerary.description: Arrive early and settle into the hotel. Spend the day with a leisurely walk on Cox's Bazar beach, beach games, and a sunset view. Try local seafood shacks for dinner.

itinerary.title: Marine Drive & Himchari
itinerary.description: Drive along Marine Drive for coastal panoramas, stop at viewpoints, then visit Himchari National Park for waterfalls and elevated viewpoints overlooking the sea.

itinerary.title: Inani Beach & Optional Boat Trip
itinerary.description: Visit Inani Beach famous for its coral stones and cleaner shoreline. Optionally take a short boat trip to nearby islands or fishing villages for local cultural interaction.

itinerary.title: Relax & Return
itinerary.description: Final morning for sunrise and a last beach walk. Free time for shopping, then depart for Dhaka by road or air.

notes: Marine Drive is best experienced during daytime and at sunset. Avoid swimming in rough surf and follow local lifeguard advice where available.

destination.name: Sundarbans
destination.overview: The Sundarbans is the world's largest contiguous mangrove forest, threaded with tidal waterways, mudflats and small islands. The area is famous for its unique biodiversity — spotted deer, saltwater crocodiles, an array of birdlife, and the elusive Royal Bengal Tiger. This 3-day boat safari focuses on exploring the channels by guided boat, visiting watchtowers and ranger stations, and experiencing the fragile mangrove ecosystem up-close. Travelers will find a tranquil, primeval environment, punctuated by cautious wildlife sightings and the distinct ecology of the Sundarbans.

itinerary.title: Gateway & River Transit
itinerary.description: Launch from Mongla/Khulna and transit into the Sundarbans, scanning mangrove-lined channels for birds and crocodiles. Attend briefing with forest guide and understand safety and conservation protocols.

itinerary.title: Safari & Watchtowers
itinerary.description: Full-day navigation of smaller creeks in search of wildlife; climb watchtowers for panoramic views and quiet observation. Learn about local mangrove ecology and tidal rhythms from your guide.

itinerary.title: Return & Visit Local Village
itinerary.description: Return towards Mongla/Khulna with stops at small mangrove-adjacent villages, buy local honey or handicrafts, and then depart for Dhaka.
activities: Visit local village or honey-collector station

weather.forecast: Tropical, humid; check tidal schedules. Certain months may have access restrictions.

notes: Sundarbans is ecologically sensitive — follow the guide's instructions at all times. Note there are seasonal closures or restrictions; confirm access before planning.

destination.name: Srimangal (Sreemangal)
destination.overview: Srimangal, often called the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh', unfolds as a patchwork of emerald tea gardens, winding country lanes, wetlands and pockets of rainforest. This 3-day escape mixes slow, soulful walks through manicured tea estates, visits to Lawachara National Park for its old-growth forest and wildlife, a tranquil boat trip on a wetland sanctuary, and indulgence in the region's famed seven-layer tea. Expect gentle hikes, fragrant tea tastings, and relaxed village encounters among rubber and pineapple gardens.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Tea Garden Walk
itinerary.description: Arrive mid-morning and start with a guided walk through nearby tea estates. Learn about tea-plucking, processing stages, and enjoy a tea-tasting session at a local garden.

itinerary.title: Lawachara National Park & Madhabpur Lake
itinerary.description: Early visit to Lawachara National Park for a forest walk and possibility of spotting macaques, birds, and the hoolock gibbon (if fortunate). Follow with a boat or walking trip to Madhabpur Lake and its surrounding wetlands.
activities: Early morning forest walk in Lawachara
Visit Madhabpur Lake for boating and photography
Afternoon visit to tribal craft shops

itinerary.title: Tea Museum & Return
itinerary.description: Visit a local tea museum or processing estate to see how leaves become tea, pick up packaged tea souvenirs, then return to Dhaka/Sylhet.
activities: Return to Dhaka or onward travel

weather.forecast: Mild and humid; mornings often misty among tea gardens

notes: Respect protected areas in Lawachara — follow guide paths and avoid disturbing wildlife. Tea-plucking seasons and factory schedules may affect tours.

destination.name: Saint Martin's Island
destination.overview: Saint Martin's Island is a tiny coral island in the northeastern Bay of Bengal, known for turquoise waters, coral fragments along the shore, and laid-back island life. This 3-day island getaway includes boat transfers, seaside relaxation, snorkeling opportunities (seasonal), and interactions with local fishing communities. Expect slow island rhythms, seafood feasts, and exceptional sunsets — a perfect respite for travelers who want a relaxing, intimate island experience.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Island Intro
itinerary.description: Travel to Teknaf and board a speedboat to Saint Martin's. After check-in, take a relaxed island walk, visit the local market and enjoy fresh seafood as the sun sets.

itinerary.title: Beach Time & Snorkeling
itinerary.description: Spend a day relaxing on the beach and snorkeling in shallow reefs (snorkel availability depends on season and local operators). Visit Coral Beach and take photographs of the unique shoreline.

itinerary.title: Island Walk & Return
itinerary.description: Early morning stroll for sunrise, a final swim or souvenir shopping, then return to Teknaf and onward transport to Cox's Bazar or Dhaka.
activities: Return by road to Cox's Bazar/Dhaka

weather.forecast: Warm sea climate; best outside monsoon months

notes: Coral and marine life are fragile — avoid touching corals and follow local guidance when snorkeling. Boat schedules may vary with weather and tidal conditions.

destination.name: Khagrachari
destination.overview: Khagrachari is a serene hill district with green ridgelines, tribal villages, cascading waterfalls, and quiet lakes. Known for attractions like Sajek-adjacent hill roads, peaceful viewpoints, and Hajachora waterfall on the way to Sajek, Khagrachari is ideal for travelers seeking off-the-beaten-path trekking, cultural encounters with indigenous communities, and easy access to nearby hill destinations. This 3-day tour focuses on accessible hikes, waterfall visits, and cultural exchange with local communities.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Local Market
itinerary.description: Arrive and enjoy a relaxed day visiting Khagrachari town, local markets and a short nature walk to acclimatize to the hills.

itinerary.title: Hajachora Waterfall & Hill Viewpoints
itinerary.description: Visit Hajachora waterfall and scenic viewpoints. Enjoy a picnic by the waterfall and a short hike around the ridge roads.

itinerary.title: Village Visit & Return
itinerary.description: Morning village visit to see traditional crafts, then depart for Dhaka with memories and local handicraft souvenirs.
activities: Shopping for bamboo and woven goods

weather.forecast: Cool mornings and pleasant days; possible afternoon showers depending on season

notes: Some waterfall access points may be remote; wear sturdy shoes and follow local guide instructions.

destination.name: Rangamati (Kaptai Lake)
destination.overview: Rangamati, centered around the vast Kaptai Lake, is a placid destination of forested hills, tranquil water vistas, and indigenous culture. This 3-day tour highlights boat cruises on Kaptai Lake, visits to tribal markets and handicraft villages, trips to the Hanging Bridge and tribal viewpoints, and relaxed afternoons by the water. Rangamati’s lake-form geography provides a calmer, reflective contrast to the high ridges of other Hill Tracts and is a favorite for photography, boat trips, and buying handcrafted goods.

details.segment: Local boat cruise on Kaptai Lake

itinerary.title: Arrival & Lakeside Walk
itinerary.description: Arrive and unwind with a lakeside walk, visiting the local bazaar and enjoying a boat-sunset on Kaptai Lake.

itinerary.title: Boat Cruise & Tribal Markets
itinerary.description: Full-day boat cruise across Kaptai Lake visiting small islands, local tribal settlements, and artisan workshops. Opportunity to buy indigenous handicrafts.

itinerary.title: Viewpoint & Return
itinerary.description: Short trek to a nearby viewpoint for sunrise and panoramic lake vistas, then return to Dhaka after a relaxed brunch and check-out.

notes: Boat schedules may vary; private launches are recommended for full-day cruises to remote islands.

destination.name: Sylhet Hills & Rivers
destination.overview: Sylhet is a lush northeastern region known for its rolling tea gardens, clear rivers, and spiritual shrines. This 3-day tour explores Sylhet’s gentle hills, the cascading waterfalls near Sylhet city, and peaceful riverbanks — plus a glance at the region’s Sufi shrines and colonial-era tea estates. The itinerary blends moderate hikes, river-side relaxation, and authentic Sylheti cuisine.

itinerary.title: Arrival & City Walk
itinerary.description: Arrive and enjoy a light city walk, visiting local markets, tea shops, and a riverside evening.

itinerary.title: Tea Estates & Waterfalls
itinerary.description: Visit nearby tea estates, take a guided plantation walk and then head to a nearby waterfall for a picnic and photo opportunities.
activities: Visit to Lalakhal (river with clear water) or nearby waterfall

itinerary.title: Shrines & Return
itinerary.description: Visit some of Sylhet's cultural shrines or gardens, buy local tea, and prepare for departure back to Dhaka.
activities: Visit Shah Jalal Shrine or other local landmarks

weather.forecast: Lush, often humid; mornings misty in tea areas

emergencyContacts.hospital: Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital

notes: Roads near river and tea estate areas can be slippery during the rainy season; plan accordingly.
